name: The Pantheon
description: Final resting place of Voltaire, Rousseau, Hugo, Zola, and Marie Curie.

name: Cafe de Flore
description: The legendary cafe where Sartre and Beauvoir wrote and debated existentialism.

name: La Sorbonne
description: Historic university founded in 1257, center of French intellectual life.

name: Pere Lachaise Cemetery
description: Final resting place of many philosophers, writers, and artists.

name: Palace of Versailles
description: Symbol of absolute monarchy that sparked Enlightenment critiques.

name: College de France
description: Prestigious institution where Foucault and Bergson lectured, founded by Francis I in 1530.

name: Les Deux Magots
description: Historic cafe frequented by intellectuals including Sartre, Hemingway, and Picasso.

name: Montaigne's Tower
description: The circular library where Montaigne wrote his famous Essays.

name: Place de la Bourse
description: Iconic Bordeaux landmark facing the Garonne River, famous for the Water Mirror (Miroir d'eau).

name: Dune du Pilat
description: Europe’s tallest sand dune with sweeping views over the Atlantic and Arcachon Bay.

name: Lascaux Cave (Lascaux IV)
description: World-famous prehistoric cave paintings (accessible via the Lascaux IV replica center).

name: Rocher de la Vierge
description: Biarritz symbol: a rocky islet linked by a bridge, with dramatic ocean views.

name: Chateau de Ferney
description: Voltaire's home for the last 20 years of his life where he wrote and received visitors from across Europe.

name: Institut Lumiere
description: Museum in the Lumiere brothers' family home, birthplace of cinema.

name: Mont Blanc (Chamonix viewpoint)
description: The iconic highest peak in the Alps, a legendary mountaineering destination.

name: Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourviere
description: Lyon’s hilltop basilica with panoramic views over the city.

name: Puy de Dome
description: Famous volcano summit in the Chaîne des Puys with sweeping views and historic science experiments.

name: Mont-Saint-Michel
description: Iconic island abbey and medieval village rising from the bay.

name: Rouen Cathedral
description: Gothic cathedral immortalized by Monet’s painting series.

name: Omaha Beach
description: Major D-Day landing beach and a key WWII memorial area.

name: Honfleur Old Harbor
description: Charming historic port known for its reflections, art heritage, and seaside atmosphere.

name: Bayeux Tapestry Museum
description: Home of the famous embroidered chronicle of the Norman Conquest.

name: Saint-Malo Intra-Muros
description: Walled corsair city with dramatic tides and rugged coast views.

name: Pointe du Raz
description: Spectacular cliff cape facing the Raz de Sein, one of Brittany’s wildest landscapes.

name: Carnac Stones
description: Prehistoric megalithic alignments, among the most famous in the world.

name: Parliament of Brittany
description: Historic civic building and symbol of Brittany’s legal and political history.

name: Quimper Cathedral
description: Gothic cathedral at the heart of one of Brittany’s prettiest old towns.

name: Notre-Dame de la Garde
description: Marseille’s hilltop basilica with sweeping views and deep local symbolism.

name: Promenade des Anglais
description: Famous seaside boulevard along the Baie des Anges.

name: Palais des Papes
description: Monumental papal palace, a key site of medieval European history.

name: Gorges du Verdon
description: Epic canyon known for turquoise waters, cliffs, hiking, and viewpoints.

name: Calanques National Park
description: Limestone inlets and cliffs meeting the Mediterranean in breathtaking coves.

name: Cite de Carcassonne
description: Fairytale medieval fortified city with walls, towers, and deep history.

name: Pont du Gard
description: Roman aqueduct masterpiece and one of France’s most famous ancient monuments.

name: Capitole de Toulouse
description: Iconic city hall and grand square at the heart of the Pink City.

name: Arenes de Nimes
description: Remarkably preserved Roman amphitheatre still used for events.

name: Pic du Midi Observatory
description: High-mountain observatory with extraordinary panoramic views over the Pyrenees.

name: Louvre-Lens Museum
description: Satellite of the Louvre showcasing major works in a modern architectural setting.

name: Grand Place (Place du General de Gaulle)
description: Historic central square surrounded by Flemish-style architecture and cafés.

name: Amiens Cathedral
description: Gothic giant and UNESCO site, among the largest cathedrals in Europe.

name: Chateau de Chantilly
description: Grand château, art collections, gardens, and the famous Chantilly cream heritage.

name: Cap Blanc-Nez
description: Dramatic white chalk cliffs overlooking the English Channel near Calais.

name: Strasbourg Cathedral
description: Masterpiece of Gothic architecture with a famed astronomical clock.

name: Place Stanislas
description: UNESCO-listed square, a jewel of 18th-century urban design.

name: Reims Cathedral
description: Traditional coronation site of French kings and a major Gothic landmark.

name: Chateau du Haut-Koenigsbourg
description: Spectacular restored medieval castle overlooking the Alsace plain.

name: Verdun Memorial / Douaumont Ossuary
description: Major WWI memorial site commemorating the Battle of Verdun.

name: Chateau des Ducs de Bretagne
description: Fortress château and museum recounting Nantes and Brittany’s history.

name: Puy du Fou
description: Famous historical theme park known for large-scale live shows.

name: Circuit des 24 Heures du Mans
description: Legendary endurance racing circuit home to the 24 Hours of Le Mans.

name: Chateau d'Angers
description: Massive medieval fortress famous for the Apocalypse Tapestry.

name: Passage du Gois
description: A tidal causeway that disappears under the sea at high tide.

name: Chateau de Chambord
description: Renaissance masterpiece linked to François I and famous for its double-helix staircase.

name: Chateau de Chenonceau
description: Elegant Loire château spanning the Cher River, associated with powerful women of French history.

name: Chartres Cathedral
description: UNESCO-listed Gothic cathedral celebrated for its stained glass.

name: Gardens of Villandry
description: Iconic Renaissance gardens with geometric patterns and ornamental beds.

name: Orleans Cathedral (Sainte-Croix)
description: Major cathedral linked to the memory of Joan of Arc and the city’s history.

name: Hospices de Beaune
description: Famed historic hospital with colorful tiled roofs and a legendary wine auction.

name: Palace of the Dukes of Burgundy
description: Historic complex in Dijon reflecting Burgundy’s powerful ducal era.

name: Basilica of Vezelay
description: Romanesque basilica and UNESCO site, an important pilgrimage landmark.

name: Citadel of Besancon
description: Vauban fortress overlooking the city, a UNESCO-listed military masterpiece.

name: Abbey of Cluny
description: Once the largest church in Western Christendom and a major medieval monastic center.
